Class LectorXML

java.lang.Object
dam.primerCurso.dao.LectorXML
public class LectorXML extends Object
The LectorXML class loads quiz questions from XML resources.

This class belongs to the DAO Layer (Data Access Object), since it is responsible for retrieving external data (XML) and mapping it into Question objects usable by the application.

Expected XML structure:

 <question id="1">
     <enunciado>What is ...?</enunciado>
     <opciones>
         <opcion>a) Option A</opcion>
         <opcion>b) Option B</opcion>
     </opciones>
     <respuesta>b</respuesta>
     <explicacion>Explanation text</explicacion>
 </question>

The parser extracts the following for each question: id, statement, options, correct answer, and explanation.

Version:
1.0
Author:
kabalera82

  • Method Details

    • readQuestionsFromXML

      public static List<Question> readQuestionsFromXML(String resourcePath)
      Reads quiz questions from an XML resource in the classpath.

      The method uses Class.getResourceAsStream(String), so the resourcePath must be relative to the root of the compiled resources (e.g. "/preguntas.xml").

      Parameters:
      resourcePath - path to the XML file inside resources/
      Returns:
      a list of Question objects. Returns an empty list if the resource is not found or an error occurs.
